For the signal callers, it was a rematch of Super Bowl 52, when Folesâs Philadelphia Eagles beat Bradyâs New England Patriots. This yearâs meeting came with a bizarre ending as Brady appeared to lose track of the downs on the Buccaneersâ final offensive play. âHe knew,â Buccaneers coach Bruce Arians told reporters when asked if Brady was aware it was fourth down. We had a great opportunity there so â¦ just didnât execute when we needed to.â After he returned to the Buccaneersâ bench, Brady was shown on camera flinging a tablet in disgust after, it appeared, he recognized his mistake. The cameras then caught Brady running off the field when the game was over, leaving a confused Foles looking around as he tried to find the six-time Super Bowl champion to shake hands. Brady also did not shake Folesâs hand after the Super Bowl loss. âI didnât get a chance to say anything to him,â Foles said during his on-field interview after the game. âIâm sure sometime weâll catch up, but weâre trying to keep our distance.â Frank Schwab of Yahoo Sports observed that Brady was doing âwhat the NFL wants him to doâ in heading for the locker room without postgame handshakes, in accordance with coronavirus guidelines. âReally, itâs no big deal,â Schwab wrote. âBut itâs Brady, so people will take their shots regardless.â Foles, 31, was 30 for 42 for 243 yards with a touchdown and an interception for his first win as the Bears starter.
